results.title: Australian animals dreaming stories
results.brief_description: First Nations peoples used stories to teach their children about the laws and myths of their land. Pauline McLeod tells five stories about unique Australian animals. Each story is laced with colourful drawings. The stories featured are: ‘The Giant goanna and the black snake’; ‘The Platypus’; ‘How the kangaroo got its pouch’; ‘Why does the kookaburra laugh?’; ‘The Bunyip’.

results.title: The Landscape architects; Fire down below
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Up a gum tree”.
“The Landscape architects” David Bellamy looks at how First Nations peoples learned to tame the countryside without becoming farmers, and at what sort of diet they enjoyed. “Fire Down Below” David Bellamy looks at the secrets of survival of the Australian flora against the frequent fires which seek to destroy.

results.title: Manyu-Wana 7
results.creator_credit: David Batty, Wendy Baarda and Warlpiri Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This episodes covers the following topics: Magic story; school children at Willowra planting seeds for a vegetable garden; dog magic; reading of a dreamtime story, “The Crimson Cat, the Bird with a Red Breast”; words for ‘in’, ‘on’ and ‘under’; tracking a person by their footprints; song about children from local communities having fun; making a healthy stew; working at Nyirrpi store; basketball teams. Suitable for Primary, Secondary and tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Batty, Wendy Baarda and Warlpiri Media

results.title: Yothu Yindi, diti murru: the videos
results.creator_credit: John Wilkinson, Martin Stauce, Stephen M Johnson, Alan James, Axolotol and Burrundi Pictures
results.brief_description: Mandawuy Yunupingu and Witiyana Marika from Yothu Yindi introduce these videos from their album “Tribal voice”. The brief introductions and the videos themselves give a simple, but telling overview of Aboriginal culture and the need for black and white society to find a common meeting place. The videos are: “Treaty”, “Mainstream”, a traditional Aboriginal dance Gudurrku = brolga”, “Treaty: Filthy Lucre mix”, “Djapana: Gapirri mix and “Tribal voice”, which encompasses a plea for all indigenous cultures to be recognised.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Wilkinson, Martin Stauce, Stephen M Johnson, Alan James, Axolotol and Burrundi Pictures

results.title: Manyu-Wana 8
results.creator_credit: David Batty, Wendy Baarda and Warlpiri Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This episode covers the following topics: Planting trees; reading of “The Bird and the Snake”, a story from Willowra; words for ‘few’ and ‘many’, using children onn the Willowra school bus; tracking, spearing and cookking kangaroo; bathing, working at the butcher’s; numbers and counting; traditional-style dance about the Easter story; chips magic. Suitable for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.

results.title: Manyu-Wana 9
results.creator_credit: David Batty, Wendy Baarda and Warlpiri Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This episode covers the following topics: Cleaning up the house; words for ‘slow’ and ‘fast’; pram magic; reading “The Emu and the Crane”, a traditional story about how the emu lost its wings; working at the clinic; words for ‘North’, ‘South’, ‘East’ and ‘West’; song about making playing humpies in a creek bed; making spinifex resin; maths: 5-2=3, using eggs. Suitable for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Batty, Wendy Baarda and Warlpiri Media

results.title: The Secret country: the first Australians fight back (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Alan Lowery and Central Independent Television (UK)
results.brief_description: According to John Pilger, “Australia is a secret country with a secret history.” This documentary looks at that history, the history of Australian First Nations peoples from the time of white settlement to the present, and reveals the extent of the cruelty and injustice inflicted upon them. The central issue throughout the film is the differing perspectives on the land and its uses, providing historical background to the present land rights movement and other areas of activism.
results.title_for_label: The Secret country: the first Australians fight back (Captioned)

results.title: Manyu-Wana 6
results.creator_credit: David Batty, Wendy Baarda and Warlpiri Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This episode covers the following topics: Golf magic; words for ‘first’ and ‘last” reading of “The Emu is looking for water’; story about bush medicine from ghost gum; dreaming story about country around Vaughan Springs; working as an administrative assistant at the school; making a sling-shot for getting birds; school children on a visit to the country of their dreamings, digging for rabbits, traditional dancing and singing about the country. Suitable for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.

results.title: Australian childhood: changes over 200 years
results.brief_description: Overviews childhood and adolescence in Australia from 1788 to 1990’s, using photographs, archival footage and printed material. Includes the topics of children’s work, access to education, children’s health, Aboriginal children, the impact of radio and TV, teenagers and consumerism and multi-cultural Australia. Provides a “potted view” of history from the perspective of children and their changing role in our society.

Provides a “potted view” of history from the perspective of children and their changing role in our society.

results.title: Manyu-Wana 1
results.creator_credit: David Batty, Wendy Baarda and Warlpiri Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This program contains the following topics: Magic; number 3; working as a stockman; reading of “The Man and the tree”; number 1; blowing noses; letter “M”; making hairstring; words for ‘wide’ and ‘narrow’; car magic; bat and ball magic. Suitable for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.
